refnamediv.refpurpose: Checks if the given key or index exists in the array

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: array_key_exists returns &true; if the given key is set in the array. key can be any value possible for an array index. array_key_exists also works on objects.

example.title: array_key_exists example
example.programlisting:
<?php
$search_array = array('first' => 1, 'second' => 4);
if (array_key_exists('first', $search_array)) {
    echo "The 'first' element is in the array";
}
?>

note.simpara: The name of this function is key_exists in PHP 4.0.6.

example.title: array_key_exists vs isset
example.para: isset does not return &true; for array keys that correspond to a &null; value, while array_key_exists does.
example.programlisting:
<?php
$search_array = array('first' => null, 'second' => 4);

// returns false
isset($search_array['first'])

// returns true
array_key_exists('first', $search_array);
?>

refsect1.para: See also isset, array_keys, and in_array.
